numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that the increase in electricity generation in China is much steeper than the increase in electricity generation in the US.
2. I noticed that the increase in electricity generation in China is much steeper than the increase in electricity generation in India.
3. The world has seen a steady increase in electricity generation.
4. Since 2010, wind power and solar power have become bigger contributors to electricity generation in the world.
5. I wonder why China has seen such a big increase in electricity generation compared to the US and India.
6. I wonder what could lead the world to use more clean power than fossil fuels to generate electricity.
7. I wonder what the next 20 years will look like.
8. From these graphs, it looks like the US is trying to move toward using more clean power.
9. The US has increased the use of wind power to generate electricity.
10. The US has increased the use of solar power to generate electricity.
11. The US may stay at a steady rate of electricity generation.
12. If the US stays at a steady rate of electricity generation, then clean power could replace more fossil fuels for electricity generation.
13. If clean power replaces fossil fuels, then electricity generation will be cleaner.
14. The headline is: How the world's generation of electricity has changed over the last 20 years.
